intro: Campanula glomerata var. longifolia, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and western Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can grow up to 30–60 cm in height. This variety is distinguished by its longer flower stems compared to the typical form of Campanula glomerata.
